intro: Eucephalus scaber, commonly known as roughhead plantain, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wetlands. It has a creeping growth habit with a fibrous root system, and its flowers are clustered in a dense, rounded head. Eucephalus scaber is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and healing effects.
